description.narrative: By 2022, selected national and sub-national level authorities have improved capacity to ensure transparent, adequate, efficient and equitable budget allocations in children related social services, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, evidence-driven, integrated and equitable social protection policies, efficient financial allocations and family-friendly local service provision are in place to address the social exclusion of children in Ukraine

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, selected national and sub-national level authorities have improved capacity to ensure transparent, adequate, efficient and equitable budget allocations in children related social services

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF utilized its advocacy and technical assistance to support both national and sub-national governments in various PF4C matters. In a turbulent environment, some of the UNICEF supported actions helped to prevent major setbacks i.e. protection of the universal child grants while others set the ground for innovative solutions such as consensus forecast with young people | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020

title.narrative: Amount (in national currency) allocated from the national budget to new (or expanded) COVID-19 social protection programmes that directly or indirectly benefit children (including on-budget development partner funds) in the reporting year [COVID]
Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children
Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting at all levels of government to improve spending outcomes for children
